metadata.title: CVE-2022-30789 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
A crafted NTFS image can cause a heap-based buffer overflow inntfs_check_log_client_array in NTFS-3G through 2021.8.22.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-30789` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ntfs-3g - 1:2013.1.13AR.1-2ubuntu2+esm3
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: ntfs-3g package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:2013.1.13AR.1-2ubuntu2+esm3').
